channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.title: Report X-2024040177
item.description:
Report X-2024040177

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-12T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-09
  • City: DAYTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ABF was loading freight next to a pallet of 4 drums. One of the drums was struck while a pallet was being loaded next to it. The bottom edge of a drum was struck and punctured. It was advised that the spill was contained on the trailer and dry when it was called in.

item.title: Report E-2024040206
item.description:
Report E-2024040206

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-11T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-08
  • City: LORDSTOWN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 9500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XAY experienced a UN2922 Nalcon 7634 release from 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 100-gallons of product released to 60' x 20' area of the concrete dock and a 40' x 15' area of the asphalt parking lot due to a forklift puncture. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted area to clean the release. All impacted absorbents were containerized into (8) 55-gallon poly drums. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with impacted absorbents and PPE into a cubic yard box. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024040208
item.description:
Report E-2024040208

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-11T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-02
  • City: PERRYSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 9000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-XTM contacted ERTS regarding a punctured leaking 5-gallon PAIL containing Endurastrip. The PAIL was punctured by a Forklift. The PAIL released all 5-gallons that impacted the wooden trailer floor and the concrete dock floor. The trailer floor had an impact area of 28’x5’. The dock floor had an impact area of 10’x1’. A Contractor cleaned up the release and repalletized the remaining, un-damaged product. Two drums of waste were generated for disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this incident.

item.title: Report E-2024040218
item.description:
Report E-2024040218

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-11T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-15
  • City: STREETSBORO
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While unloading freight from trailer material handler discovered a box that was slightly wet. Further investigation revealed that the enclosed plastic container had a loose lid which as a result consequently leaked some product out of and onto the box. The lid was tightened and the box put aside until it dried then it was placed into a recovery container and sent to the ultimate consignee without further incident.

item.title: Report E-2024040130
item.description:
Report E-2024040130

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-10T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-02
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 2, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of resin solution was punctured by the shipper's skid and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel utilized hand tools, cleaners, absorbents, and a sprayer unit to remediate the site. All spent absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 35-gallon drums. The damaged 55-gallon drum of product was placed into one (1) 85-gallon drum. All containers were staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024040101
item.description:
Report E-2024040101

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-09T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-09
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO Logistics
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1-gallon of regulated UN1263 "Activator - Mid Temp" was released from a one-gallon metal pail due to being punctured by a forklift during dock operations impacting Dock #155. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller who felt comfortable completing the clean-up with terminal-issued PPE. The damaged metal pail, PPE, and impacted Oil Dri was containerized in one (1) 30-gallon metal drum.

item.title: Report E-2024040107
item.description:
Report E-2024040107

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-08T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-03
  • City: LORDSTOWN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XAY experienced a UN1992 Activ-8 release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup of the release. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 30 -gallons of product released to the entire trailer floor and a 15’ x 10’ area of the asphalt and concrete lot below due to a forklift puncture. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents were then deployed to clean the impacted areas. All impacted absorbents, pads, and PPE were then containerized into (4) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024040076
item.description:
Report E-2024040076

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-08T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-28
  • City: MAPLE HEIGHTS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 28, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN3265 was damaged due to a load shift and released approximately sixteen (16) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed absorbents to the release and patched the damaged tote. The crew conducted a tote transfer and swept up the spent absorbents. All impacted material was containerized in eight (8) 55-gallon drums for transport and disposal. The damaged 330-gallon tote and transferred tote of product were taken back to the terminal.

  • Description: XPO contacted ERTS to report a damaged plastic pail of regulated UN2880 "Blue Crystal Tablets" located at Terminal XEL. The caller stated that a one-quart plastic pail's lid was damaged by other freight during loading operations impacting Trailer #311-9185.
